page.title: 02The Aire and Calder Canal
page.content: The{Aire and Calder Navigation}was first built in{1700}by{James Brindley.The canal is nine feet deep and eighteen feet six wide.The locks are two hundred and twenty feet long and twenty nine feet wide.The canal makes it possible to travel from Leeds to Goole.The traffic using the Aire and Calder Navigation are { {Tankers,pleasure boats}and{long boats. The most common are pleasure boats and tankers.The tankers travel through our area because of the{Oil depot}in Oulton which contains { {oil,petrol,gas,gas oil}and {diesel. } The largest barges on our stretch of canal carry 700 tonnes.The 2 locks in Woodlesford/Oulton are Lemon Royd lock off Fleet Lane and Woodlesford lock off Pottery Lane.
